definition: a popular style of clothes, hair, etc. at a particular time or place; the state of being popular
the dried leaves of the tobacco plant that are used for making cigarettes, smoking in a pipe, etc.
one of the round objects under a car, bicycle, bus, etc. that turns when it moves
a feeling or an opinion, especially one based on emotions
the process of improving or developing, or of getting nearer to achieving or completing something
an argument between two people, groups or countries; discussion about a subject on which people disagree
great respect and approval; a good opinion of somebody
to save somebody/something from a dangerous or harmful situation
used to emphasize the great degree of something
the action of making something less intense or severe; the fact of becoming less intense or severe
to make somebody feel bored, especially by talking too much
one of the various types of powder or seed that come from plants and are used in cooking. Spices have a strong taste and smell.
to feel certain that something is true or that somebody is telling you the truth
moving, reacting or working more slowly than normal
to give money to pay for goods, services, etc.
to tie somebody/something with rope, string, etc. so that they/it cannot move or are held together strongly
to say that something is true although it has not been proved and other people may not believe it
the organ in the chest that sends blood around the body, usually on the left in humans
the hard solid material that forms part of the surface of the earth and some other planets
typical of the country or of country people; simple
a person or thing that you use or have instead of the one you normally use or have
in addition; too
to tell somebody to do something, especially in a formal or official way
the act of eating something
existing in large numbers
not covered by any clothes
a formal promise to do something or a formal statement that something is true
the part of the human body that is on the opposite side to the chest, between the neck and the tops of the legs; the part of an animal’s body that corresponds to this
a substance that you use to make things stick together
a single unit of language that means something and can be spoken or written
away from a place; out
a state of feeling or being happy or satisfied
a piece of furniture that consists of a flat top supported by legs
to think something or have an opinion about something
an attempt to find somebody/something, especially by looking carefully for them/it
a public or religious occasion that includes a series of formal or traditional actions
a person who shows other people the way to a place, especially somebody employed to show tourists around interesting places
necessary or essential in order for something to succeed or exist
a feeling of being extremely tired, usually because of hard work or exercise
a person or an animal in a book, play or film
not physically strong
a group of countries or states that are controlled by one leader or government
the hot gas that water changes into when it boils
to make letters or numbers on a surface, especially using a pen or a pencil
wanting to do something
a rule, a fact, an idea, etc. that limits or controls what people can do
relating to diseases spread by sexual contact
finished; completed
very great; felt or experienced very strongly
a person who works in an office, working for another person, dealing with mail and phone calls, keeping records, arranging meetings with people, etc.
a large strong building with thick, high walls and towers, built in the past by kings or queens, or other important people, to defend themselves against attack
a white substance found in many types of rock, especially clay
to think about something carefully, especially in order to make a decision
to remove clothes
money given as a promise that you will pay a debt, appear in court, etc.
a false idea or belief, especially about somebody or about a situation
fully grown and ready to be eaten
completely necessary; extremely important in a particular situation or for a particular activity
very impressive; very beautiful
the sport or business of catching fish
a small organ near the stomach that controls the quality of the blood cells
the belief that somebody/something is good, sincere, honest, etc. and will not try to harm or trick you
principles relating to right and wrong or good and bad behaviour
a large area of land, usually without exact limits or borders
the fair treatment of people
the act of giving food to a person, an animal or a plant
one of a series of things that you do in order to achieve something
a word used to mean ‘woman’ that some people, especially older people, consider is more polite
used to say what must happen or be done to make it possible for something else to happen
a table or small shop with an open front that people sell things from, especially at a market
a person who you think behaves or speaks in a way that lacks intelligence or good judgement
an agreement to marry somebody; the period during which two people are engaged
to discover somebody/something unexpectedly or by chance
a legal agreement that allows you to use a building, a piece of equipment or some land for a period of time, usually in return for rent
the process of somebody getting a higher or more important rank
a person who is kept in prison as a punishment, or while they are waiting for trial
a person who leads a group of people, especially the head of a country, an organization, etc.
a person’s continued support for a political party, religion, leader, etc.
a person who is in charge of something, especially an officer in charge of a particular group of soldiers or a military operation
rails (= metal bars) that a train moves along
of a higher standard or less poor quality; not as bad as something else
feeling or showing pleasure; pleased
not ordinary or usual; different from what is normal
a period of time in which somebody is taught something
having good health and not likely to become ill
containing or holding as much or as many as possible; having no empty space
to find or discover somebody/something by looking carefully for them/it
the surface of the earth that is not sea
affecting all or most people, places or things
a consonant pronounced with a breath that can be heard, for example the /h/ sound in house in English
that existed in earlier times
the feeling that somebody/something is without value and deserves no respect at all
extremely large
a metal that is formed by mixing two types of metal together, or by mixing metal with another substance
an insect, often large and black, with a hard case on its back, covering its wings. There are several types of beetle.
any of the long fibres that carry messages between the brain and parts of the body, enabling you to move, feel pain, etc.
a place where you can sit, for example a chair
enough for a particular purpose; as much as you need
to be likely to do something or to happen in a particular way because this is what often or usually happens
the state of feeling or showing happiness and enthusiasm
